column1: Mawana is a city in Meerut district in the Uttar Pradesh state of India.  Its name comes from the  word "Muhana" which means gateway. It is supposed to be the Muhana of Hastinapur kingdom. Hastinapur is a Mahabharata period town situated 9 km from the city center.
The river Ganga is 10 km from Mawana. NH-34 joints Meerut to Mawana then Mawana to Bijnor.
Mawana is a Nagar Palika Parishad city in district of Meerut
